thread.title: Cong questions govt’s intent on RTI Act
thread.title_full: Cong questions govt’s intent on RTI Act

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Cong questions govt’s intent on RTI Act
text: New Delhi, October 12 As the Right to Information Act turned 10 years old today, the Congress, which piloted the law, questioned the NDA government’s “disinterest” in empowering the legislation. The Congress not only asked why Prime Minister Narendra Modi had decided to skip the convention, but also questioned why the event had been shifted from October 12, the day the law was enacted, to October 16. Led by Ahmad Patel, political secretary to Congress president Sonia Gandhi, the Congress today saluted the law saying it had given people power. “The phrase RTI ‘file kar doonga’ (will file a plea under the law) has become a symbol of people’s power. This transformative piece of law completes 10 years. Well done India!” tweeted Patel. — TNS
